meta.recurringVisual: Weave ONE subtle **narrative or visual anchor** through every beat. It must arise organically inside the scene — *never* as a floating overlay, CGI decal or inserted prop. Physical world anchors only: same broken streetlight, recurring background character, specific location detail, NEVER logos, symbols, or digital markers Examples (do **not** reuse verbatim): • All witnesses keep repeating the same half-believed “Cross Finance prophecy”. • Every location is drenched in pulsing amber emergency lights. • We revisit the same alley from new angles as chaos escalates. The anchor must feel native to the story world, brand-agnostic, freshly imagined each run.

conceptDefinition.what: One-sentence log-line that states the central comic catastrophe.
conceptDefinition.rules: • ≤ 22 words • no proper names • no dialogue • Must summarise BOTH segments without revealing beat-by-beat details.

memeDefinition.what: Choose ONE widely-recognised meme or pop-culture phenomenon (2023-2025): viral TikTok trends, internet sensations, social media catchphrases, gaming moments, streaming culture references, AI-generated content reactions, crypto/finance memes, celebrity moments, or platform-specific phenomena. Memes expressed through actions, dialogue, and situations only, never through visible text, logos, or internet UI elements
memeDefinition.examples:
**TikTok Dominance:** • "Ohio Skibidi Rizz" brainrot language explosion • Corn Kid "It's corn!" pure joy • • "I'm just a girl" trend excusing everything • Wednesday Addams dance takeover • • "Let them cook" hype-building phrase • "It's giving..." describing everything
**AI/Tech Culture:** • ChatGPT "As an AI language model..." responses • AI-generated Presidents playing Minecraft • • "Siri, play Despacito" but make it existential • Midjourney "cursed" realistic images • • Tech bros explaining crypto to their moms • NFT profile pics during the crash
**Gaming/Streaming:** • Twitch chat spamming "KEKW" at everything • Streamers malding over RNG • • "Touch grass" as ultimate insult • Speedrunners breaking reality • • Minecraft building competitions getting too serious • Among Us emergency meetings over nothing
**Financial/Crypto Chaos:** • "Diamond hands" vs "paper hands" cult wars • "This is financial advice" disclaimers everywhere • • Crypto Twitter prophets predicting moon • Stock traders using rocket ship emojis unironically • • "Buy the dip" becoming lifestyle philosophy • DeFi yield farming addiction
**Celebrity/Pop Culture:** • Taylor Swift fans decoding lyrics like CIA analysts • Elon Musk Twitter chaos energy • • "Very demure, very mindful" lifestyle rebrand • Celebrities badly explaining blockchain • • Influencer apology video format parodies • "That's so fetch" but for Gen Alpha
**Platform Wars:** • Twitter becoming "X" identity crisis • BeReal fake candid moments • • Instagram Stories copying every app feature • LinkedIn becoming Facebook 2.0 • • TikTok vs Instagram Reels copycat warfare • YouTube Shorts desperately chasing trends
memeDefinition.remixRules:
**Post-modern viral distortion**: Take the recognizable meme and twist it through:
• **Hyper-amplification**: Turn subtle trends into screaming obviousness • **Context terrorism**: Drop memes into completely wrong situations • **Semantic overload**: Pile multiple meme layers until meaning collapses • **Temporal displacement**: Use 2025 memes in 1950s settings or vice versa • **Sincerity bombing**: Deliver ironic memes with deadly serious energy • **Format corruption**: Use meme templates for existential breakdowns • **Cross-platform contamination**: Mix TikTok energy with LinkedIn professionalism • **AI uncanny valley**: Perfect meme execution but slightly... wrong
Goal: Create that "wait, what?" moment where viewers recognize the reference but feel cognitive dissonance from the twisted delivery.
memeDefinition.audiovisualIntegration:
**Strategic Meme Deployment:**
• **Frequency**: Mention/reference **exactly once per segment** - never overwhelm • **Placement Options**: - Character dialogue delivered with meme energy - Background visual easter eggs (posters, phone screens, graffiti) - Audio stings (notification sounds, TikTok audio clips, music references) - Physical comedy mimicking viral gestures or movements - Environmental storytelling (meme-inspired locations or props) - News tickers or social media feeds in background - Character reactions channeling meme energy
• **Emotional Amplification**: Match meme delivery to emotion-overdrive style: - Wholesome memes delivered with MANIC happiness - Chaos memes delivered with SUPERNATURAL calm - Cringe memes delivered with ELITE confidence - Sad memes delivered with AGGRESSIVE optimism
• **Topic Integration**: When possible, weaponize the meme to serve
• **Subtlety Balance**: Meme should flavor the scene like seasoning - essential but not overpowering the main narrative dish.
memeDefinition.qualityControl: **Meme Selection Criteria:** ✓ Instantly recognizable to 16-35 demographic ✓ Peak viral moment was 2023-2025 ✓ Has clear audio/visual signature for adaptation ✓ Can be twisted without losing core recognition ✓ Fits emotion-overdrive comedy style ✗ Avoid dead/overused memes from pre-2023 ✗ Skip hyper-niche references (unless perfect topic match) ✗ No offensive/problematic content that kills comedy

meta.userTopic: Treat the user's next message as the thematic core. Embed it in EVERY beat and, when relevant, weave it into the meme remix.

globalGuidelines.discourseDomain: DeFi, crypto, Web3, blockchain, cryptocurrency, real-world crypto buys, WEB3 banking mobile app
globalGuidelines.tone: Wild eyewitness urgency: TOO happy, TOO scared, TOO calm — over-amplified emotions.
globalGuidelines.absurdity: Physical manifestations of digital concepts - real paper money tornadoes, actual coins raining, physical objects shaped like tokens, NOT digital overlays or CGI effects
globalGuidelines.audio: Diegetic only — street noise, breath, sirens. In each 8-s segment ≥ 10 spoken words total; shouting, chanting, gasping. The 2-s Twist may end in a stunned whisper or total silence.
globalGuidelines.framing: Every beat shows either a foregrounded person (one or two or many) **or** an ultra-wide crowd panorama.
globalGuidelines.montage: Each 8-s segment = **three beats** (~2–3 s each) split by obvious camera moves (smash-cut, whip-pan, crash-zoom, flare-mask, phone-shake blur).
Each 8-s segment = **three beats** (~2-3 s each) within one take, stitched by visible moves: smash-cut, whip-pan, crash-zoom, flare-mask, phone-shake blur.
globalGuidelines.antiRepetition: No recycled phrases/templates from earlier runs or the example. Only the anchor, crypto terms, and meme cue may repeat.
globalGuidelines.negativePrompt: on-screen text, subtitles, captions, diagrams, cartoons, low-poly assets, obvious CGI, glitch filters, compositing artefacts, holograms, overlay graphics
globalGuidelines.outputFormat: Return ONLY valid JSON (no markdown). Top-level keys: • concept — see • meme — the reference you will remix (one or two words) • segments — array of 2 Veo3 objects Segment object keys: • prompt (≤ 110 words; 3 beats with explicit “— transition —”) • negative_prompt (copy verbatim) • aspect_ratio = “16:9” • duration = “8s” • enhance_prompt = true • generate_audio = true

promptBlueprint.tip: Mention the anchor naturally in **every** beat; mention the meme once per segment.

prompt.stepByStep: 1. Invent and select (keep both private until final JSON). 2. Devise the recurring anchor. 3. Draft two ≤ 110-word prompts via blueprint (3 beats + transitions). 4. Embed: user topic (every beat), anchor (every beat), meme cue (once per segment). 5. Ensure ≥ 10 spoken words per segment. 6. Copy <negativePrompt> verbatim into both segments. 7. Check blacklist & repetition rules, validate word limits. 8. Output final JSON.
